summary: The Credit Incentives for Resilient Critical Utility Infrastructure and Transformers Act (CIRCUIT Act) aims to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to incentivize the production of distribution transformers. It expands the advanced manufacturing production credit to include these transformers, providing a 10% credit on production costs. The bill defines "distribution transformer" by referring to the Energy Policy and Conservation Act and specifies an effective date of 90 days after enactment.
